conclusion: Use given information about state change of ideal gas on p-V diagram and apply thermodynamics principles.
State A: pressure 1 × 10^5 Pa, volume 1 × 10^-3 m^3; State C: pressure 3 × 10^5 Pa, volume 4 × 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate temperature change using internal energy change: ΔU = N_A ΔT, ΔT = 200 / N_A.
Calculate temperature at state C: T_C = T_A + ΔT = 273 + 200 / N_A.
Convert temperature from K to Celsius: T_C = 306.33 K = 306.33°C.
Convert temperature at state C to degrees Celsius: 306.33°C = 306.33 - 273 = 33.33°C.
Final answer: Temperature of gas at state C is 33.33°C.
